definitions.definition: A period of time spent doing or being something; a spell.
definitions.example: He had a stint in jail.

definitions.definition: Quantity or task assigned; proportion allotted.
To stop speaking or talking (of a subject).

definitions.example: The next party you throw, don't stint on the beer.

definitions.definition: To restrain within certain limits; to bound; to restrict to a scant allowance.
To assign a certain task to (a person), upon the performance of which he/she is excused from further labour for that day or period; to stent.
(of mares) To impregnate successfully; to get with foal.
Any of several very small wading birds in the genus Calidris. Types of sandpiper, such as the dunlin or the sanderling.
